translated: Translated by Tripitaka Master Bodhiruci of India during the Tang Dynasty
Chapter 11, Part 4: The Assembly of the Appearance of Light
When the World-Honored One entered the city, countless beings
Heard what was said in the sky and attained the wisdom of the limit of the eye.
When the World-Honored One entered the city, countless beings
Heard what was said in the sky and understood the self-nature of the eye,
Ultimately empty and without self, all attaining the purity of the eye.
Ear, nose, tongue, body, mind, form, sound, smell, taste, and touch,
Up to sounds and names, all are like this.
Greed, anger, delusion, resentment, arrogance, stinginess, jealousy, deceit, and conceit,
Up to negligence, you should know are also like this.
When the World-Honored One entered the city, countless kinds of beings
In the sky above heard the various names of the Buddha:
Or hearing of the destruction of greed, with a name unequaled;
Or hearing of the destruction of anger, with a name benefiting the world;
Or hearing of the understanding of delusion, with a name subduing arrogance;
Or hearing of showing the world, with a name of a tranquil guide;ğŸ”½Or hearing of manifesting wisdom, with a name benefiting the world;
Or hearing of manifesting skillful means, with a name benefiting beings;
Or hearing of subduing demons, with a name of no resentment;
Or hearing of using the teaching method, with a name manifesting liberation;
Or hearing of widely liberating, all suffering beings;
Or hearing of the honored one among humans, with a name delivering the world;
Having heard these various names, all attain the purity of the eyes.
Space, the oceans, and even Mount Sumeru,
All can be measured, but the Buddha's wisdom is inexhaustible.
If one attains certainty regarding the exhaustion of the eye, accomplishing the Dharma body will not be difficult,
If one can accomplish the supreme Dharma body, one will attain boundless dhÄraá¹‡Ä« wisdom.
If one attains boundless dhÄraá¹‡Ä« wisdom, one will realize the innumerable sÅ«tras,
If one realizes the innumerable sÅ«tras, attaining the Buddha's spiritual powers will not be difficult.
If one attains certainty regarding the arising of the eye, accomplishing the Dharma body will not be difficult,
If one can accomplish the supreme Dharma body, one will attain boundless dhÄraá¹‡Ä« wisdom.
If one attains boundless dhÄraá¹‡Ä« wisdom, one will realize the innumerable sÅ«tras,
If one realizes the innumerable sÅ«tras, attaining the Buddha's spiritual powers will not be difficult.
In the same way, the ear, nose, tongue, body, mind, form, sound, smell, taste, and touch,
Up to sounds and names, and so forth, should all be understood in the same way.ğŸ”½Here is the corrected and aligned text:
At that time, the great earth all shook, and so did the great oceans and mountains,
The asura multitudes and all the gods, all gave rise to joy.
The demons and their armies destroyed flattery and deceit, and all sought to accomplish the adornments of the Buddha,
The various gods each dwelling in their wondrous palaces, with pure minds joyfully congratulated each other, saying:
The guide has now appeared in the world, for the benefit of all humans and heavenly beings.
The gods dwelling on the earth, in their own palaces, also with pure minds congratulated each other,
Excellent! The guide has now appeared, as a universal cause for the peace and happiness of the world.
The gods flying in the sky, hearing these words, all joyfully gave rise to pure faith,
With delightful voices they praised the Buddha, The guide has appeared to benefit the world.
The multitudes of gods of the Heaven of the Four Kings, hearing these words, all joyfully gave rise to pure faith,
With a supreme voice, they praise the Buddha, the guide who appears in the world to benefit beings.
The assembly of the Heaven of the Thirty-three, hearing these words, all rejoice and give rise to pure faith,
With a supreme voice, they praise the Buddha, the guide who appears in the world to benefit beings.
The assembly of the Heaven of YÄma, hearing these words, all rejoice and give rise to pure faith,
With a supreme voice, they praise the Buddha, the guide who appears in the world to benefit beings.
We should give rise to the bodhi mind and aspire to the unsurpassed wisdom of the TathÄgata,
Relying on the most honored one among gods and humans, to liberate all kinds of sentient beings.
The assembly of the Tuá¹£ita Heaven, hearing these words, all rejoice and give rise to pure faith,
With a supreme voice, they praise the Buddha, the guide who appears in the world to benefit beings.
The TathÄgata, in the past, for koá¹­is of kalpas, cultivated boundless supreme practices,
Showing the path of peace to suffering beings, enabling them to transcend birth and death and realize nirvana.
The assembly of NirmÄá¹‡arati Heaven, hearing these words, all rejoiced and gave rise to pure faith,
With the most excellent voice, they praised the Buddha, saying the guide appears to benefit the world.
The assembly of ParanirmitavaÅ›avartin Heaven, hearing these words, all rejoiced and gave rise to pure faith,
With subtle sounds, they praised the Buddha, saying the guide appears to benefit the world.
The TathÄgata has already crossed over birth and death, subdued the mÄras and non-Buddhists,
Accomplishing the unsurpassed Buddha-bodhi, rescuing sentient beings and enabling them to reach the other shore.
The assembly of BrahmÄ Heaven, hearing these words, all rejoiced and gave rise to pure faith,
With subtle sounds, they praised the Buddha, saying the guide appears to benefit the world.
In this way, the sound passed on and on, and the BrahmÄ retinue all rejoiced,
The guide appears to benefit the world, the demon army is frightened and worried.
Up to the heavenly beings at the peak of existence, hearing that the Buddha appears to benefit the world,
In this way, the sound spreads everywhere, the asuras are diminished and the devas increase,
The demon palaces are all empty, the heavenly beings are all filled,
With the power of fearlessness, subduing the evil ones, quickly attaining the supreme great enlightenment.
In this way, the heavenly beings of the realm know that the World-Honored One appears to benefit all beings,
Excellent, the guide of the world, bestowing the pure eye upon sentient beings.
When the World-Honored One enters the city, those oppressed by desire and lust,
Hearing the teaching on impurity meditation, desire and lust are extinguished without remainder.
When the World-Honored One enters the city, those oppressed by anger and hatred,
Hearing the teaching on loving-kindness and compassion, anger and hatred are extinguished without remainder.
When the World-Honored One enters the city, those oppressed by foolishness,
Hearing the Dharma of wisdom expounded, their foolishness is extinguished without remainder.
When the World-Honored One enters the city, those oppressed by arrogance,
Hearing the Dharma of leaving behind arrogance, their arrogance is extinguished without remainder.
When the World-Honored One enters the city, those oppressed by jealousy,
Hearing the Dharma of leaving behind jealousy, their jealousy is extinguished without remainder.
When the World-Honored One enters the city, those oppressed by anger,
Hearing the Dharma of leaving behind anger, their anger is extinguished without remainder.
When the World-Honored One enters the city, those oppressed by stinginess,
Hearing the Dharma of leaving behind stinginess, their stinginess is extinguished without remainder.
If one cultivates the practice of self-discipline and hears this boundless Dharma,
One will enter the ocean of much learning and accomplish the gate of dhÄraá¹‡Ä«s.
Moreover, one hears it said in space: using flowers to make offerings to the Buddha,
Accomplishing supreme merits, the great compassionate spiritual transformations are explained.
Moreover, hearing it said in the sky, praising the TathÄgata's body,
The places of birth and clans, the voice and sound are all supreme.
Like the destinies of those beings, the spiritual powers are explained according to their types,
Eyes, ears, nose, tongue, body, if form, if sound, etc.,
Bending, stretching, or bowing, what is manifested is all supreme.
The TathÄgata transcends the world, yet acts as a lamp and torch for the world,
Manifesting various forms and appearances, all are the spiritual power of the Buddha.
Ordinary beings delight in attachment to form, for the sake of manifesting various bodies,
According to the types of those beings, it is said that form is not solid.
If a person has much attachment, the TathÄgata manifests spiritual power,
According to their vessels and non-vessels, the contradictory Dharma is explained for them.
Beings for immeasurable eons have never made offerings to the Buddha,
For those who are stubborn and difficult to tame, he speaks of the hells.
If people are confused about the path of karma and rely on views to enjoy frivolous arguments,
The World-Honored One causes them to hear the sounds of ceasing views and frivolous arguments.
Moreover, they hear it said in space: The nature of the eyes is definitely empty,
Without coming or going, without characteristics, and without existence.
Moreover, hundreds of thousands of sentient beings hear it proclaimed in space:
The flesh eyes, the wisdom eyes, and up to the Dharma eyes.
By the World-Honored One's spiritual powers, they hear the sounds of speaking about precepts and concentration,
Wisdom, liberation, and the sounds of the knowledge and insight of liberation.
Sentient beings of various kinds manifest spiritual powers in accordance with their dispositions,
And with sounds that accord with their kinds, they expound the true Dharma.
If there are sentient beings who enjoy cultivating giving, morality, and patience,
With spiritual powers, they speak in accordance with their kinds, with the sounds of giving, morality, and patience.
The World-Honored One's spiritual powers, in accordance with the capacities of sentient beings,
All extensively distinguish them, causing them to uphold and expound them.
The World-Honored One's spiritual powers, hearing the teaching on the aggregates, realms, and sense bases,
Bondage and liberation, far and near, the characteristics of the stages and levels.
Also hearing the teaching on the stages, the immeasurable light of wisdom,
Also hearing about the habitual tendencies of afflictions, some are eliminated, some are not.
The World-Honored One's spiritual powers, hearing the teaching on the natures of humans and gods,
Due to the differences in karmic results, there are distinctions in rebirth.
Or in the midst of a gathering of women, manifesting a female body adorned with ornaments,
The empty voice speaks of disenchantment, those who hear eliminate craving and desire.
If one has pure faith in ÅšÄriputra,
Great compassion manifests accordingly and teaches the unsurpassed Dharma.
KurÅ«á¹­a KÄÅ›yapa, KÄtyÄyana, Nanda,
MahÄkÄÅ›yapa, Kauá¹‡á¸inya, and others,
According to their preferences, heard the teachings of the Å›rÄvakas.
The devas, asuras, and various yaká¹£a assemblies,
The retinue of Vemacitrin, and innumerable kumbhÄá¹‡á¸as,
Heard the dhÄraá¹‡Ä« incantations through the Buddha's spiritual power:
Also, with VaiÅ›ravaá¹‡a, Dhá¹›tarÄá¹£á¹­ra, and others,
With innumerable marvelous sounds, they expounded the true incantation methods.
Such immeasurable sounds were spoken by the Well-Gone One's spiritual powers,
The spiritual powers are immeasurable, and the teachings are also boundless.
In buddha-lands where there is no Buddha, they play with spiritual powers,
The Buddha's body surrounded by the assembly, just as seen now.
In inconceivable buddha-lands, they manifest immeasurable transformations,
First born, taking seven steps, renouncing the royal position and going forth,
At the site of enlightenment, attaining perfect enlightenment, contemplating the Dharma that was attained,
Turning the wheel of the Dharma for the sake of the assembly, manifesting entry into nirvana,
And with the power of spiritual penetrations, expounding various teachings,
Causing innumerable sentient beings to accomplish supreme wisdom.
At that time, the one of great compassion appeared, surrounded by the Brahma assemblies,
Expounding the Dharma of cultivating kindness, expanding the mind of kindness.
At that time, the one of great compassion appeared, surrounded by the celestial assemblies,
Expounding the four means of magnetizing, expanding the practice of the four means of magnetizing.
At that time, the one of great compassion appeared, surrounded by the dragon assemblies,
Expounding the faults of anger, causing them to abandon the mind of anger.
At that time, the one of great compassion appeared, surrounded by the assemblies of yakshas,
Expounding the faults of harm, causing them to abandon the mind of harm.
At that time, the one of great compassion appeared, surrounded by the asura assemblies,
Speaking of the faults of fighting and quarreling, praising the cultivation of a patient mind.
At that time, the Greatly Compassionate One manifested, surrounded by garuá¸as,
Speaking of the faults of discord, praising the mind of harmonious unity.
At that time, the Greatly Compassionate One manifested, surrounded by gandharvas,
With boundless loving speech, praising the TathÄgata.
At that time, the Greatly Compassionate One manifested, surrounded by mahoragas,
Censuring the teachings of non-Buddhist paths, praising the teachings of the TathÄgata.
At that time, the Greatly Compassionate One manifested, surrounded by a multitude of ghosts and spirits,
Extensively praising the TathÄgata's rare and wondrous merits and virtues.
The Greatly Compassionate One manifested spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear the teaching on the limit of the eye's exhaustion, ultimately able to penetrate it.
The Greatly Compassionate One manifested spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear the teaching on the origin of the eye, ultimately able to penetrate it.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear the explanation of the limit of the eye, they are ultimately able to penetrate it.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear the explanation of the revolving of the eye, they are ultimately able to penetrate it.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear the explanation of the quiescence of the eye, they are ultimately able to penetrate it.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear the explanation of the non-existence of the eye, they are ultimately able to penetrate it.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear the explanation of the non-arising of the eye, they are ultimately able to penetrate it.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear the explanation of the extinction of the eye, they are ultimately able to penetrate it.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
Hearing the teaching of no-self in the eyes, one can ultimately penetrate and understand.
Out of great compassion, one manifests spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear the teaching of no-person in the eyes, one can ultimately penetrate and understand.
Out of great compassion, one manifests spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear of no sentient beings in the eyes, one can ultimately penetrate and understand.
Out of great compassion, one manifests spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear of no life in the eyes, one can ultimately penetrate and understand.
Out of great compassion, one manifests spiritual transformations, causing hundreds of thousands of sentient beings
To hear of no nourisher in the eyes, one can ultimately penetrate and understand.
Out of great compassion, one manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all sentient beings,
Reproaching worldly wisdom, not allowing attachment to arise.
Out of great compassion, one manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all sentient beings,
Reproaching worldly benefits, praising the merit of the unconditioned.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all beings,
Censuring contaminated wisdom, praising uncontaminated discernment.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all beings,
Censuring mundane meditations, extolling supramundane concentrations.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all beings,
Censuring contaminated precepts, praising uncontaminated trainings.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all beings,
Censuring the faults of the narrow mind, extolling the virtues of the magnanimous mind.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extolling the cultivation of precepts for the body,
And up to the mind and discernment, uncontaminated and without support.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extolling the path to the cessation of suffering,
Those who delight in frivolous discourse are reproached by the Buddhas.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all beings,
Distinguishing the eyes and severing faults, revealing the characteristics of quiescence.
Ear, nose, tongue, body, mind, form, sound, smell, taste, and touch,
Up to sound and name, all are like this.
Out of great compassion, manifesting spiritual transformations, extensively for all sentient beings,
Those in their prime, young and strong, showing them boundless faults.
Out of great compassion, manifesting spiritual transformations, extensively for all sentient beings,
Those who are arrogant in their place of birth, showing them boundless faults.
Out of great compassion, manifesting spiritual transformations, extensively for all sentient beings,
Those who are arrogant in their clan, showing them boundless faults.
Out of great compassion, manifesting spiritual transformations, extensively for all sentient beings,
Those who indulge in enjoyment, showing them boundless faults.
Out of great compassion, manifesting spiritual transformations, extensively for all sentient beings,
Those who indulge in self-mastery, showing them boundless faults.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all sentient beings,
For those who are heedless in form, he shows its boundless faults.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all sentient beings,
For women who are heedless, he shows their boundless faults.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all sentient beings,
For those who are heedless in clothing, he shows its boundless faults.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all sentient beings,
For those who are heedless in alcohol, he shows its boundless faults.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all sentient beings,
For those who are heedless as kings, he shows their boundless faults.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all sentient beings,
For those who are heedless in precepts, he shows their boundless faults.
Out of great compassion, he manifests spiritual transformations, extensively for the sake of all sentient beings,
are shown the boundless faults.
Thus, the spiritual powers of enlightenment, the skillful meditation, the arrogance,ğŸ”½The wealth, the fame, the retinue,
the music and singing,
are the praise and glorification, the offerings and the material benefits.ğŸ”½The flattery of the beautiful, the pride, the shamelessness and lack of conscience,
the arrogance and the full-blown pride, the heedlessness and greed,ğŸ”½The great compassion manifests spiritual transformations,
revealing to all beingsğŸ”½those with inferior minds and intentions,
are taught the superior thoughts.ğŸ”½The great compassion manifests spiritual transformations,
revealing to all beingsğŸ”½those who are self-deprecating and timid,
are taught the power of diligence.ğŸ”½The great compassion manifests spiritual transformations,
revealing to all beingsğŸ”½those who are attached to wealth and possessions,
are taught the Dharma of contentment.ğŸ”½Also transforming into fragrant palaces,
and into palaces of flowers,
All holding marvelous towers, with transformed Buddhas sitting within.
Also transforming into celestial maidens, dwelling in the golden shower tree palace,
All manifesting half their bodies, holding flower garlands to make offerings.
Also transforming into celestial maidens, dwelling in the pÄrijÄta palace,
All manifesting half their bodies, holding golden garlands to make offerings.
Also transforming into asura maidens, dwelling in the mÄndÄrava palace,
All manifesting half their bodies, holding flower garlands to make offerings.
Also transforming into celestial maidens, dwelling in the blue lotus flower palace,
All manifesting half their bodies, praising the Buddha's merits.
Also transforming into various BrahmÄ Heavens, sitting in true golden palaces,
Fully manifesting their entire bodies, with compassionate voices praising the Buddha.
Also transforming into celestial maidens, with various adornments on their bodies,
Bells and pendants brushing against each other, emitting subtle and wonderful sounds.
Speaking of all conditioned phenomena, they are impermanent and unstable,
Foolish people falsely discriminate, unable to know them as they truly are.
Thus, the sounds of these ornaments do not come from body or mind,
They have no going or coming, and no location,
Up to form and mind, all are like this,
Fools are unable to contemplate, and give rise to doubt about this.
Thus, the wonderful sounds that emerge from these ornaments
Are heard in hundreds of thousands of lands, liberating countless beings.
You should observe the natural wisdom of the guide,
The body of boundless merit, surpassing attachment and idle speculation.
Tranquil and free from faults, dispelling the mental obscurations of views,
Adorned with excellent characteristics, body and mind are both pure.
You observe the Buddha entering the city, like the gait of a lion,
The gait of the king of geese and the king of elephants, fulfilling the wishes of sentient beings.
Accomplishing supreme blessings, adorned with true characteristics,
Causing all sentient beings to gaze upon him without ever tiring of it.
You observe the Honored One with two feet, the one endowed with a great compassionate mind,
Although he makes offerings with few things, he attains immeasurable merit.
He is able to cause all sentient beings, for many hundreds of thousands of eons,
Up to the realization of nirvana, the fruits and rewards are inexhaustible.
You observe the Honored One with two feet, who has accomplished the precepts without outflows,
Causing all sentient beings to respectfully bow their heads in reverence.
The immeasurable multitudes of gods, each abandoning their palaces,
Not indulging in playful amusements, they draw near to the guide.
You observe the demons and their people, who have faith and joy in the Buddha,
All holding golden-handled fans, attending to him on the left and right.
Five hundred demon sons, with heavenly delightful flowers,
Together scattered upon the TathÄgata, seeking unsurpassed wisdom.
Having once praised and made offerings to the buddhas of the past,
Now encountering the World-Honored One, each one is filled with joy,
Also with immeasurable eloquence, praising the TathÄgata.
At that time there was a demon son named Abandoning Affection,
The first to praise the Buddha, able to know the limit of the eye,
Also understanding the origin of the eye, up to the characteristic of quiescence.
Also knowing the limit of the eye and so forth, the boundless meaning and phrases,
Using skillful words and phrases, expounding for sentient beings,
Yet within the names and meanings, without attachment, without doubt or confusion.
Understanding the absence of coming and going, without grasping and also without abandoning,
The intrinsic nature always empty and quiescent, far removed from written words,
There will also be none who can uphold, recite, and practice it.
The TathÄgatas of the past have already extensively revealed
That it is through provisional names, but in reality there is nothing to be said.
Thus, emptiness of intrinsic nature transcends the aggregates, elements, and sense bases,
Without falsehood or truth, and also without right or wrong,
Up to the cessation of language, the mind's activity also ceases.
Because foolish people are attached to characteristics, they see the Buddha entering the city,
The World-Honored One is free from all characteristics, but foolish people falsely discriminate.
When the World-Honored One enters the city, if people give rise to joy,
This is discrimination based on characteristics, and they will surely harbor sorrow and distress.
If one is free from discrimination based on characteristics, then one does not see entering the city,
Up to the characteristics of movement, one attains non-discriminating wisdom.
If one sees the Buddha through characteristics, then one sees entering the city,
In the Dharma of birth and turning the wheel, all are discriminated.
If one sees the Buddha through characteristics, even giving rise to joy,
That person abides in the activities of MÄra, and the realm of MÄra is always present.
If one sees the Buddha through characteristics, one will see change,
This person will have sorrow and grief, and the wise should have compassion for them.
If one sees attainment in the Dharma, then there is the sorrow of losing the Dharma,
If one sees birth in the Buddha, then there is the suffering of nirvÄá¹‡a.
If one cultivates for many eons and understands all characteristics,
One does not discriminate entering the city, nor does one have the notion of nirvÄá¹‡a.
If one understands the emptiness of the characteristics of the mind, one abides in the place of the Buddha's practice,
One does not discriminate entering the city, nor does one have the notion of nirvÄá¹‡a.
If a person knows in this way, then they see the buddhas,
And are also able to understand the emptiness of nature, ultimately without birth or cessation.
The World-Honored One, for innumerable eons, cultivated various austerities,
In order to realize the emptiness of nature, but foolish people cannot understand.
When the World-Honored One entered the city, hundreds of thousands surrounded him,
Humans and non-humans, with pure minds, made offerings.
If, for a mere instant, one contemplates the limit of the extinction of the eye,
And thoroughly understands the emptiness of all characteristics, one's merit surpasses that.
Even a fraction of the calculation cannot reach it.
Thus, the limit of the arising of the eye, the limit of its turning,
And even up to its cessation, one should know it is also like this.
Ear, nose, tongue, body, mind, form, sound, smell, taste, and touch,
Up to sound and name, all are like this.
At that time, when the World-Honored One was about to enter the city, he pressed his foot on the ground,
All shaking and trembling, the mountains inclined towards the Buddha,
Humans and gods for the Dharma, all coming to pay respect.
When entering the city, the heavenly kings, human kings, and asura multitudes,
And the various yakshas, each abandoning their original cities, came to where the Buddha was,
Joyfully making offerings.
Furthermore, there were innumerable various birds, parrots, peacocks,
And kalavinka birds, seeing the Buddha, the Tathagata, with his supreme merits and virtues,
In the sky, joyfully playing and frolicking, all emitting various
Subtle and wonderful sounds.
By the power of the Buddha's merits and spiritual power, he was able to cause innumerable
Hundreds of thousands of beings, the blind to see, the deaf to hear,
For those who are incomplete, let them attain completeness, for those who are not at peace,
let them attain peace.
In the sky, hear this said: If one discriminates the TathÄgata based on various characteristics,
this person is not said to be making offerings to the Buddha,
and also does not understand the nature of the exhaustion of the eye.ğŸ”½If one abandons various characteristics and plants various roots of virtue,
then one will be able to understand the nature of the exhaustion of the eye.
Because one is able to understand the exhaustion of the eye,
then one will be able to understand the merits of the buddhas.
In the arising of the eye, there is no reliance, in the quiescence of the eye,
there is no stirring thought, this person then sees the TathÄgata.
In the arising of the eye, there is no discrimination, in the limit of the eye,
There is no intentionality, regarding the eye's cessation and destruction, there is no indication,
This person then sees the TathÄgata.
Without attachment, regarding the eye's non-arising, without grasping,
Regarding the eye's quiescent cessation, without clinging, this person then
Sees the TathÄgata.
Knowing the limits of the eye, regarding the faculties, one is certain; knowing the eye's arising,
Regarding the faculties, one is self-mastered; this person then sees the TathÄgata.
Knowing the eye's non-existence, regarding form, one has penetrating insight; knowing the eye's cessation and destruction,
Regarding the Dharma, one contemplates; knowing the eye's non-arising, regarding the path, one cultivates,
This person then sees the TathÄgata.
Regarding the eye's limit, regarding the distinctions in karma, one is also able to understand,
Because they can understand the distinctions in karma, these people
Will be able to see the TathÄgata.
They will also be able to understand the distinctions in suffering,ğŸ”½Because they can understand the distinctions in suffering, these people
Will be able to see the TathÄgata.
Because they truly understand the cessation and destruction of the eye,ğŸ”½They will also be able to understand the cessation and destruction of suffering,
Because they can understand the cessation and destruction of suffering,
These people will be able to see the TathÄgata.ğŸ”½Because the eye does not exist, they will also be able to understand
The separation from all characteristics,
Because they can understand the separation from all characteristics, these people
Will be able to see the TathÄgata.ğŸ”½They will also be able to understand the separation from habitual tendencies,
Because they can understand
Because they are free from habitual tendencies, such people are said to see the TathÄgata.
Moreover, they accurately know the impermanent nature of the eyes, and regarding the removal of obstructions,
they are also able to understand. Because they are able to understand the removal of obstructions,
such people are said to see the TathÄgata.
The eyes are without words, and regarding the power of the Buddha's wisdom, they are also able to understand,
because they are able to understand the power of the Buddha's wisdom, such people are said to
see the TathÄgata.
Regarding the removal of all desires, they are also able to understand, because they are able to understand
the removal of all desires, such people are said to see the TathÄgata.ğŸ”½Moreover, they accurately know the cultivation of meditative concentration, and regarding the removal of afflictions,
they are also able to understand. Because they are able to understand the removal of afflictions,
Such a person will then see the TathÄgata.
Accomplishing such, the wisdom of the limit of the eye, the wisdom of the non-abiding eye,
The wisdom of the unborn eye, the wisdom of the Buddha's supernormal powers, the wisdom of the inferiority of the eye,
The wisdom of the superiority of the eye, the wisdom of the inferiority of wisdom, the wisdom of the purity of wisdom,
The wisdom of the purity of precepts, the wisdom of bodily discipline, the wisdom of the purity of voice,
The wisdom of verbal discipline, the wisdom of the purity of mind, the wisdom of the distinctions of mental states,
The wisdom of mental factors, the wisdom of the faults of the mind, the wisdom of the purity of karma,
The wisdom of mental discipline, the wisdom of the faults of wisdom, the wisdom of the purity of sound,
The wisdom of the distinctions of the aggregates, the wisdom of the causes and conditions of the aggregates, the wisdom of the thorough knowledge of the eye,
The wisdom of the arising of suffering, the wisdom of uncontaminated precepts, the wisdom of the causes and conditions of precepts,
The wisdom of the causes and conditions of suffering, the wisdom of the extinction of the causes of suffering, the wisdom of conditioned things,
The wisdom of extinction and non-extinction, and also the wisdom of knowing the twelve links of dependent origination as they really are,
The wisdom of having activity and the wisdom of having no activity, the wisdom of having characteristics and the wisdom of having no characteristics,
